title: (x) "Playbill" w/triangular serifs - Latin {Lex}
content:
Any idea what typeface this is? (“PLAYBILL”)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014628im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/PlayBillLogo_sm_5764.jpg)

Thank you!

 [‹ World of Warcraft Font "The Burning Crusade" logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014628/http:/www.typophile.com/node/35657 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Sun Microsystems "Simplify. Automate." narrow sans - Sun {Mike D} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014628/http:/www.typophile.com/node/35658 "Go to next forum topic")
author: merz

comments.content:
Well it’s not Playbill:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=Playbill](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014628/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=Playbill "http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=Playbill")

Maybe Spike Bold:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/quadrat/spike/](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014628/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/quadrat/spike/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/quadrat/spike/")

I suggested PL Latin Bold when this came up before:

[http://www.typophile.com/node/28612](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014628/http:/www.typophile.com/node/28612 "http://www.typophile.com/node/28612")

- Lex

My friend works at Playbill, and he says that they have a custom font based on the logo. You can see some examples of it in the videos [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014628/http:/www.playbill.com/multimedia/video.asp) in the credits at the end.
